description.narrative: Governments have strengthened capacity for child rights-based policy formulation, planning and budgeting, particularly in target countries.

mailing-address.narrative: 3rd & 5th Floors FDB Building 360 Victoria Parade Suva

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Pacific Islands United Nations Sustainable Development Framwork
Pacific Islands Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Policy Evidence and Social Protection)
UNICEF Programmes in Pacific Islands (Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Programmes in Pacific Islands (Social Inclusion)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Governments have strengthened capacity for child rights-based policy formulation, planning and budgeting, particularly in target countries.

description.narrative: UNICEF Pacific continued to engage and strengthen partnerships with governments to influence policy formulation, planning and budgeting to address the socio-economic challenges faced by children and women in the region. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Amount (in national currency) allocated from the national budget to new (or expanded) COVID-19 social protection programmes that directly or indirectly benefit children (including on-budget development partner funds) in the reporting year [COVID]

baseline.value: Fiji - FJD 133.6 m; Cook Islands - NZD 18.2 m

actual.value: 2020:Fiji: Additional FJD 6.6 million is allocated in FY 2020/2021. Cook Islands: Additional NZD 1.9 million is allocated in FY 2020/2021.

title.narrative: Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty

baseline.value: Fiji-1; Kiribati-1; FSM-1; Solomon Islands-1;Tonga-1 ;Tuvalu-1;RMI-1; Vanuatu-1; Palau -1

actual.value: 2019:Fiji-2 Kiribati-2 FSM-1 Solomon Islands-2 Tonga-2 Tuvalu-2 RMI-2 Vanuatu-2 Palau -1

title.narrative: Amount (in USD $) of funds leveraged for COVID-19 response in social sectors from the IFIs: IMF, World Bank, Regional Development Banks in the reporting year [COVID]

actual.value: 2020:USD7.55 million from ADB for COVID-19 Response Supplies.
